subject: Search dashboard
description:
As a User I want to search for a specific provider by name.

Acceptance Criteria:  
 - Filter items by a specific provider name and display only matching items

subject: Filter dashboard
description:
As a user I want to filter/sort providers by designation, status, service model, impact level.

Acceptance Criteria:  
 - Allow for filtering of items based on identified data points
 - Allow for sorting of items based on identified data points

subject: Identify agency performance
description:
As a FedRAMP employee I want to use the total number of cloud products an agency uses on the dashboard so that I can easily identify agencies who are doing well at leveraging the FedRAMP process and those who are not.

Acceptance
 - track agencies by the number of total cloud products they use
 - make sure all CFO agencies are represented in the dashboard
 - users can sort on the number of cloud products

subject: Pull data for reports
description:
As a FedRAMP dashboard user I want to easily pull data from the dashboard so that I can import that into into other reporting tools.

Acceptance Criteria
 - provide a download button from the dashboard to provide the data
 - have the file save locally
 - output the JSON data into CSV format
 - default filename for the download to be include date

subject: Visual representation of Agency
description:
As an Agency I want to see a visual representation of my agency and associated data so that I can see the list of services that are already in use inside my agency, or similar agencies.

Acceptance:
  - list of services that are used within the agency 
  - Services contain provider name and associated cloud service
  - No need for assessors listed in detail
  - Users can easily see the list of services

subject: Provider check status
description:
As a CSP I want to quickly check my current status, progress, and estimated time to completion for my ATO so that I and others interested in utilizing my services understand where I am in the FedRAMP authorization process.

Acceptance Criteria:  
 - The provider status displays the “double checkmark” icon when appropriate
 - The provider status is textually displayed
 - The provider progress is displayed
 - The estimated time to ATO completion is available where applicable

subject: Compare 2 (or more?) CSP providers
description:
As a CSP, FedRAMP employee, agency, or other user I want to compare 2 (or maybe more?) CSP providers next to each other.

Acceptance Criteria:  
 - Select two CSPs for comparison
 - Display detailed information for selected styles
 - Highlight key differences

subject: Review which agencies use a service
description:
As an agency I want to see the other agencies who use a specific Cloud Service Offering so that I can determine whether to re-use that agencies documentation to get my ATO.

Acceptance
 - the list of agencies using the service appears in the service details page
 - users can easily find the list of agencies using an offering during user testing

subject: Monitor CSP Authorizations
description:
As an OMB, agency, or FedRAMP employee I want to quickly see how many times an CSP's authorization has been re-used and by which agencies.

Acceptance Criteria
  - Make sure the calculations currently in use are accurate (work with Matt and data team)
  - Users can easily see the authorization numbers
  - Add the list of dependent CSP services (effectively show the "math" behind the number). 
  - Verify the dashboard data matches the master spreadsheet data calculations
  - Users understand what the term "authorizations" means by way of visual cue (tooltip/help context)

subject: OMB Persona
description:
As a Designer I want to create an OMB Persona to help understand the FedRAMP dashboard needs of that classification of user.

Acceptance Criteria:

   Persona Card
   - User Interviews of OMB users performed
   - Determine the user's goal in viewing the dashboard
   - Determine High level metrics user groups is interested in
   - Determine how they utilize the dashboard data outside the dashboard

subject: Agency Persona
description:
As a Designer I want to create an Agency Persona to help understand the FedRAMP dashboard needs of that classification of user.

Acceptance Criteria:

Persona Card
- User Interviews of Agency users performed
- Determine the user's goal in viewing the dashboard
- Determine High level metrics user group is interested in
- Determine how they utilize the dashboard data outside the dashboard

subject: CSP Persona
description:
As a Designer I want to create an CSP Persona to help understand the FedRAMP dashboard needs of that classification of user.

Acceptance Criteria:

Persona Card
- User Interviews of CSP users performed
- Determine the user's goal in viewing the dashboard
- Determine High level metrics user groups is interested in
- Determine how they utilize the dashboard data outside the dashboard

subject: Data model updates
description:
As a developer I want to refine the FedRAMP JSON data model provided for the dashboard so that I have the data I need (columns in the format required) to create dashboard elements to fulfill user needs.

Acceptance Criteria:

  Functional data model
   - Refine the columns based on user interview feedback
   - Work with Laura to fix output issues
   - Test

subject: Total Authorizations
description:
As an OMB user I want to see the total number of Authorized CSPs so I can see how many CSPs have successfully completed the FedRAMP Security Assessment Framework.

Acceptance Criteria
   - The number of authorized CSPs is calculated by taking a unique count of CSP Names from the FedRAMP JSON data.
   - The CSPs are non-private; the Leveraged-ATO value = ~~Yes~~, No, TBD, or ~~PRV~~

subject: Total Reuse
description:
As an OMB user I want to see the total number of ATOs that reused existing ATOs so that I can see how many Agencies efficiently leveraged the FedRAMP authorization process.

Acceptance
 - Determine the nested relationships with re-uses - include how the number is derived
 - The nesting logic has been confirmed by the fedRAMP and 18f data team
 - ~~The nesting logic has been confirmed by the OMB~~ (FedRAMP will interface with OMB)
 - Logic to calculate the total reuses leverages the nested relationships to derive an accurate number

subject: Dashboard Design Concepts
description:
As a FedRAMP dashboard designer I want to explore ways of visually displaying the FedRAMP dashboard data so that I can communicate efficiently with the FedRAMP customer and adhere to the US Web Design Standards.

Acceptance Criteria:  
 - Wireframes for the design concepts
 - Style tiles for comparison of style approaches
 - FedRAMP approval of wireframes
 - FedRAMP approval of style tile
 - 18f approval of style (based on adherence to US Web Design Standards)

subject: View 3PAO
description:
As a CSP I want to see what type of services a 3PAO provides so that I can choose an accredited 3PAO with relevant experience to be my auditor.

Acceptance
 - contains a description of their services
 - users can easily find the 3PAO's service description

subject: What work has a 3PAO done
description:
As a FedRAMP dashboard user I want to see how many CSPs a 3PAO has worked with or is currently working with so that I can gauge the 3PAOs level of experience in the FedRAMP Security Assessment Framework and their potential availability.

Acceptance
 - listing of products they've worked with - name/service of the product 
 - users can easily find the 3PAO's services

subject: Filter by category
description:
As a FedRAMP Dashboard user I want to filter the dashboard data by category so I can only see items of interest belonging in the selected criteria

Acceptance Criteria:
  - CSO filters: Name, Service Model, Deployment Model, Impact Level, Status
  - CSP filters: Name, Service Model, Deployment Model
  - 3PAO filters: Name, Agencies, Products, Providers
  - Agency filters Name, Assessors, Products, Providers
  - Settle on final filter user experience based on user testing/feedback and Matt's approval

subject: Print Dashboard
description:
As a FedRAMP Dashboard user I want printer friendly output, so that I can easily print my dashboard view and maintain my filter selections in my printer output. 

Acceptance Criteria:
 - a user-friendly version printed version of the dashboard
 - non-important elements are hidden from print view

subject: In-process Timeline
description:
As a FedRAMP Dashboard user I want to view the in-process timeline for CSOs so that I can see where offerings are in the FedRAMP authorization process to help me determine when new offerings will become available.

Acceptance Criteria:
 - agree on user interface design/comp
 - can users complete the user test task for processing the timeline

subject: View Authorization Dates
description:
As an Agency I want to see CSP’s FedRAMP authorization dates so that I can determined which CSPs are currently authorized, or about to be authorized, and determine how much longer the CSP’s authorization is valid.

Acceptance Criteria:
 - Dates of interest (dates are relative to the phase the CSP is in: Ready; In-Process; Authorized)
      - Start Date (in-process date)
      - Estimated Date (show in gray)
      - Achieved/Authorized Date
 - Don't show date areas if the field is empty in the incoming data
 - Agree on design comp to prototype
 - User testing confirms the dates are easy to find/read

subject: Punch list
description: All items from this description moved to Related Tasks below

subject: Transition Guide
description:
As a FedRAMP technical user I want to have a technical transition guide so that I can easily deploy the FedRAMP dashboard product and have instructions for adding new CSPs/CSOs, Agencies, and 3PAOs to the dashboard.

Acceptance Criteria
 - Contains instructions for deploying the code
 - Contains instructions for adding new CSPs/CSOs, Agencies, and 3PAOs to appear in the dashboard
 - Government has reviewed and approved the document contents
 - Government has user-tested the procedures 
 - Contains instructions for adding new filters
 - Add to the repository GitHub README file

subject: Data Dictionary
description:
As a FedRAMP Dashboard user I want to view a data dictionary from the dashboard so that I can understand the columns that are in the CSV downloads of the dashboard data.

Acceptance Criteria:
 - There is a data dictionary link on the dashboard that takes you to a separate page showing the dictionary
 - the data dictionary shows the contents of the data dictionary .json provided by data.gov
 - Users can easily navigate back to the dashboard from the dictionary
 - Users can easily find the dashboard link

subject: 3PAO Consulting Details
description:
As a FedRAMP Dashboard user I want to view details on 3PAO companies and any additional consulting services they provide so that I can chose a 3PAO based on the services they provide and their relevant past performance in those areas.   

Acceptance: 
- In remediation status
- Company founded year
- Primary office locations
- CSPs/CSOs you are providing consulting services to
- Does your company provided consulting services (Y/N)?
- Consulting services description
- CSP you provide consulting services to
- Additional cyber frameworks
